text:
hello, i’m <https://agnescameron.info/|agnes> — I work as a technician and a lecturer at university of the arts london’s creative computing institute, and also work on games/writing/art-related things.

I spend a lot of time thinking about how people develop a sense of agency in relation to technology. I recently came across the tadi web ‘slippy mindset’ page + thought it was a great articulation of something I often try to get across in my teaching and technical work — that there’s always more than one way to do something.

I’m also really interested in collective knowledge structures and tools for describing/realising them — I’ve run a reading group for a few years now called the <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fXfCHIDHeX1qqdZPSkj2chz0AVdvBR4-46-U87hM0sc/edit|Knowledge Arrangement Reading Group> (it’s an open group if anyone here wants to join) + am also an enthusiastic (if intermittent) wikipedia editor.

right now, I’m doing a <https://www.bellingcat.com/become-a-2024-bellingcat-technical-writing-fellow/|technical writing fellowship> with Bellingcat around diverse satellite imaging indices, thinking a lot about ‘meta-methods’ for thinking about imaging as a physical process. I’m also just starting a research project around developing knitting software, and also learning to make DIY synths (in the autumn I’m going to run a ‘circuit diagram reading group’ at the CCI where we make synthesisers together from scratch).

I think it’s really cool that this space exists! If anyone is based in london and wants to come visit the CCI / hang out and talk about coding things lmk :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Hi Agnes, I’m London-based and I’d love to visit CCI, and I just saw that in recent KARG meetings you discussed Eleanor Rosch and Christopher Alexander who both represent topics <https://stefanlesser.substack.com/|I’ve immersed myself in for some time>. Would be great to connect. Feel free to DM me. I also try to make it to most of the local FoC meetups <@U0275EZH3UN> organizes about every two months.
